oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of the Middle Temple to the Earl of Shrewsbury: Private Letter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from the Middle Temple to Gilbert, earl of Shrewsbury. The letter is provisionally dated before Christmas 1597. The record also appends an "endorsement" from Shrewsbury indicating a response and payment via "Mr Davyes" of Middle Temple.

London, Lambeth Palace Library, Talbot 3199, Letter 249; 1597; English; paper; bifolium; 290mm x 195mm. Now paginated 249â€“52 and bound in a volume of miscellaneous papers relating to the Talbot family; originally bound in Talbot Manuscript, Shrewsbury Letters, Vol. H, formerly at the College of Arms.
Alan Nelson relies on this exchange to date the performance of the Prince d'Amour as 1597-8.
The letter appears in the printed Inns of Court Collection, Vol. 1, p. 129-30.
